intro: Conanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of hair. It produces small, violet or blue flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
